channel.title: Bytecode Bot RLY
channel.description:
I'm working on a bytecode bot with Maclof, and so far we've got quite some stuff done in the two days we've worked.
Progress board: [url=http://xc17.ulmb.com/smf/index.php?board=27.0]http://xc17.ulmb.com/smf/index.php?board=27.0[/url]
Current: - A bot manager - News - An account creation feature - Navigator - World selection - Loader hook - Client loads
Here's some pictures.
World Selector [img]http://xc17.ulmb.com/htamrefta/hTAMrefTAworld.jpg[/img]
Manager [img]http://xc17.ulmb.com/htamrefta/hTAMrefTAmanager.jpg[/img]
Manager-Version Two [img]http://xc17.ulmb.com/htamrefta/hTAMrefTAmanagertabs.jpg[/img]
Account Creator [img]http://xc17.ulmb.com/htamrefta/hTAMrefTAacct.jpg[/img] [img]http://xc17.ulmb.com/htamrefta/hTAMrefTAacctadvprox.jpg[/img]
The progress section I linked to has details on the components I don't have pictures from, and detail on how things work. There's no information as of now on the actual bot classes, but they do exist and work.
The free/members icons on the memberlist are switched, but I'll fix that later.

I’ve been offering him help though.
It’s called Zaveo Bot btw.

<frank_> BOTS ARE LIKE OS’ MADE BY MOPARSCAPERS

Crashes every 5 minutes but has an autorestarter.

a mopar linux distro would crash every 5 minutes
but it would have an auto restarter
[/quote]

It would be constructed of snippets of code taken from different sources. And it would fail.[/quote]

And the code would be horribley placed and not neat…
then they would say
“liek wurs kernal.java!!!”

item.title: Bytecode Bot RLY
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

maclof:

Its coming along nicely, not a whole lot to do now in terms of the stages, as soon as the scripting side of it is complete, we can begin working on the methods used within scripts, which is the most fun part imo.

First, I need to make the mouse / keyboard input somehow, then you need to write a loginIndex hook, which we can use for the getStatus method. After we get that done, it shouldn’t be too hard.

I Am Olan14:

Ahem, once more, what will the scripts look like?

Extend our abstract Java script classes, or use text scripting.

Read full topic

item.title: Bytecode Bot RLY
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

I’ve been working on a progress report generator. Here’s a graph:

It can do text too, but I didn’t include that in this pic.

The report creator can manage multiple graphs, mark times by name, check times elapsed since a marked time by it’s name, and do all that funky stuff.

This is just random data generated by the following code:

        Random random = new Random();
        ProgressReport testReport = new ProgressReport();
        testReport.markTime("startTime");

        int oresMined = 0;

        String plotName = "Progress Report - Ruleblader2 - Ores Mined";
        testReport.createXYPlot(plotName);

        testReport.addMarkToPlot(plotName, testReport.getMillisElapsedSince("startTime"), oresMined);
        for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
            try {
                Thread.sleep(1000);
            } catch (InterruptedException e) {
                //
            }
            oresMined += 5 + random.nextInt(10);
            testReport.addMarkToPlot(plotName, testReport.getMillisElapsedSince("startTime"), oresMined);
        }

Read full topic
